entries.meaning: A vessel made of clay or stone; a pot of stone or earth.
A wall of brick, stone, or cement, used as a lining, as of a well, cistern, etc.; a steening.
(UK, dialectal) A large box of stones used for pressing cheese; a cheese-press.

verbs.description: stean (third-person singular simple present steans, present participle steaning, simple past and past participle steaned)

entries.meaning: To pelt with stones; throw stones at; stone.
To fit with stones; mend, line, pave, etc. with stones.
